name: Rat
comment: The rat family produces some of the world’s most adaptable animals. Small rodents, they are omnivorous mammals known for long, thin tails, short legs, relatively large heads, and incredibly flexible bodies. They are quick scurriers, adept climbers, and strong swimmers. With their strong gnawing teeth and malleable bone structure, these creatures burrow their way through or into virtually any unarmored nook. Some (10%) rats produce a litter every 21-50 days. Also, some (5%) carry deadly diseases, either with their associated vermin (e.g., fleas) or internally (the latter communicated with a bite).
